title: Does humanity possess the technological capabilities to stop an Earth annihilating asteroid from impacting the planet? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes - providing we detect it a LONG time in advance. The problem with something that’s moving SO fast and which weighs SO much - you can’t stop it and you can’t destroy it. So all you can do is to deflect it, so that it misses. Bad Sci Fi movies have the governments of the world launching every nuclear weapon available at it. But this wouldn’t create a reliable force in the right direction to deflect the asteroid…and we know that some asteroids are relatively fragile and might split into multiple smaller asteroids that would be even harder to deflect. So what is needed is a GENTLE force - applied for a long period of time - not just whacking it hard and hoping. What we’ll need to do is to spot the killer asteroid 20 or 30 years before it’s projected impact. Then we can carefully tailor a spacecraft to fly out to the asteroid - and either push gently against it for years - to fly a parallel course alongside it. Doing that would create a very gentle gravitational force between asteroid and spacecraft - which would subtly but VERY precisely adjust it’s course. A change in direction of even a tiny fraction of one degree builds up to an enormous difference in the position of the asteroid decades later - resulting in a safe “MISS” rather than a catastrophic “HIT”. What the world needs is not some pre-built, ready to go, emergency solution to the problem. We need decades of warning. So what is required is a lot of powerful telescopes - and a lot of observers looking through them…and that’s what we actually have! Right now, the experts are fairly certain that they’ve found all of the asteroids that are big enough to cause a global catastrophe anytime within the next 50 years…and none of them are a risk.

I doubt it. First, we’d have to detect it — and if it were dark enough, fast enough, and small or dense enough (kinetic energy is 1/2 the mass times velocity-squared), we wouldn't have the resources to deflect it before it was too late, even if we had the technology. Second, the taxes wouldn't be well enough received in time to do the work, given the “not gonna happen” attitude many of us have — and another common one, “get your revenge/top of the heap/fun now, because we’re dead no matter what we do”. Some years ago, I wrote a devilishly skewed “End of the World” short-short story that has Earth launching a colony Ark with (hopefully) enough genetics, embryos, seeds, etc. and all the knowledge of humankind and its gods alike, with the hope the space colony would survive to ensure humanity could preserve itself somewhere in orbit. [I can’t find the files now (probably in an 8086’s HDD) ] The flaw in the ointment (I do mean “flaw”) is related as the comet nears Earth, and the astronauts radio back that something terrible has happened — all of the files are in FRENCH. And in Paris, people are cheering. La France va vivre !
